intro: Leucanthemum nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese marguerite, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its white to pale yellow flowers with a central yellow disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate and ornamental touch to the landscape.
